name: Scrape & Analyze Google Ads with Bright Data API and AI for Email Reports

user.name: Zacharia Kimotho
user.bio: Automation expert with years of experience helping businesses improve their efficiency and productivity with smart automations that are affordable, scalable, and flexible.

description:
*This workflow contains community nodes that are only compatible with the self-hosted version of n8n.*

This workflow is a gem for all PPC managers and experts out there looking to keep track of competitor ads and the campaigns they are running and generate an email report 
![image.png](fileId:1819)
How does it work
1. We use Bright Data API to scrap Google for a given keyword that can trigger an ad. We then extract and analyse different components of the ads to get insights and data rekevant for our processes 

Setting it up
1. Make a copy of this workflow to your canvas
2. Make a copy of this [google sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QU9rwawCZLiYW8nlYYRMj-9OvAUNZoe2gP49KbozQqw/edit#gid=0)
3. Add high intent commercial keywords to your google sheet. These are relevant to trigger ads
4. Set your Bright Data API credentials and update the zone to your respective zone as set on your Bright Data account
5.  We filter only if ads are found and if true extract the top and botton ads
6. This routes the results via different paths

   1. Store raw Ad results
   2. Process the Ads to get new insights and data

7. Map the raw data to match your account
8. You can adjust the prompt to provide any data as needed
9. Connect your emailing platform or tool and update the to email

## Setting up Bright Data serp API and Zone

1. On Bright Data, go to the [Proxies & Scraping](https://brightdata.com/cp/zones) tab
2. Under SERP API, create a new zone
3. Give it a suitable name and description. The default is `serp_api`
3. Add this to your account
 
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out via [linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zacharia-kimotho/)

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

parameters.content:
- Make a copy of this [G sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1QU9rwawCZLiYW8nlYYRMj-9OvAUNZoe2gP49KbozQqw/edit?usp=sharing)

- Add your desired keywords
- We loop over each item one at a time

- Map keyword and country code 
- Update the Zone name to match your zone on Bright Data
- Run the scraper

## Setting up SERP scraper in Bright Data

1. On Bright Data, go to the [Proxies & Scraping](https://brightdata.com/cp/zones) tab
2. Under SERP API, create a new zone
3. Give it a suitable name and description. The default is `serp_api`
3. Add this to your account

messageValues.message:
=You are an expert in advertising psychology and copywriting analysis.

You will be given JSON data for one or more Google Ads, including `title`, `description`, and possibly `extensions`.

Your job is to analyze and extract structured insights about the advertiser's messaging style and strategy.

For each ad:

1. Identify the **core value proposition** (what are they offering and to whom?).
2. Classify the tone as one or more of: 
   - **Emotional hook** (e.g., fear, trust, urgency, hope)
   - **Rational benefit** (e.g., affordability, proven ROI, features)
3. Detect the presence of marketing claims or persuasive devices such as:
   - Guarantees (‚Äúwe guarantee‚Äù, ‚Äúmoney back‚Äù)
   - Results-focused (‚Äúget more traffic‚Äù, ‚Äúincrease conversions‚Äù)
   - Authority/credibility (‚Äúaward-winning‚Äù, ‚Äútop-rated‚Äù)
4. Extract common phrase patterns (e.g., ‚ÄúYour satisfaction guaranteed‚Äù, ‚ÄúIn a market full of stars‚Ä¶‚Äù)

Output format should be JSON with fields:

```json
{
  "advertiser": "<display_link or domain>",
  "value_proposition": "<summary of their offer>",
  "tone": ["trust", "urgency", "rational"],
  "messaging_features": ["guarantee", "ROI", "authority"],
  "common_phrases": ["Your satisfaction guaranteed", "We'll make yours shine the brightest"]
}

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
[{
  "advertiser": "<display_link or domain>",
  "value_proposition": "<summary of their offer>",
  "tone": ["trust", "urgency", "rational"],
  "messaging_features": ["guarantee", "ROI", "authority"],
  "common_phrases": ["Your satisfaction guaranteed", "We'll make yours shine the brightest"]
}]

parameters.fieldsToExclude: referral_link, image, image_base64, rank, global_rank, image_alt

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
[{
  "advertiser": "<display_link or domain>",
  "value_proposition": "<summary of their offer>",
  "tone": ["trust", "urgency", "rational"],
  "messaging_features": ["guarantee", "ROI", "authority"],
  "common_phrases": ["Your satisfaction guaranteed", "We'll make yours shine the brightest"]
}]

messageValues.message:
=You are a digital marketing analyst specializing in ad funnels and call-to-action strategies.

You will be provided with JSON ad data including `extensions` where each extension may be of type `site_link`.

Your task is to:

1. Extract all `site_link` extensions and list their link text + destination.
2. Categorize each link by destination type:
   - "service", "landing page", "blog", "pricing", "case study", "contact", "grant", etc.
3. Detect if the link contains tracking or UTM parameters.
4. Identify patterns in CTA strategies across ads (e.g., are most advertisers linking to grants, blog content, or specific services?)

Output format should be:

```json
[{
  "advertiser": "<display_link or domain>",
  "site_links": [
    {
      "text": "SEO Services",
      "url": "https://www.tryboostlocal.com/marketing-services/seo/",
      "type": "service",
      "has_utm": false
    },
    ...
  ],
  "cta_focus": ["services", "grants", "conversion-optimized pages"]
}]

parameters.fieldsToExclude: referral_link, image, image_base64, rank, global_rank, image_alt

messageValues.message:
=
You are a search engine marketing analyst.

You are provided with JSON ad data including the `keyword` that triggered the ad and the full ad metadata.

Your task is to:

1. For each ad, map the keyword to:
   - The advertiser (display_link or domain)
   - The ad's value proposition or theme
2. Compare ads across keywords:
   - Identify if advertisers reuse the same ad across multiple keywords
   - Highlight differences in messaging per keyword

3. Identify and cluster related keywords (e.g., "business automation", "workflow automation") and how their associated ads differ.

Return a structured summary like:

```json
[{
  "keyword": "Business automation",
  "ads": [
    {
      "advertiser": "tryboostlocal.com",
      "title": "SEO Agency | We Guarantee Results",
      "value_proposition": "Full-service SEO with results guarantee",
      "core_focus": "SEO services for local businesses"
    }
  ],
  "related_keywords_cluster": ["workflow automation", "small business automation"],
  "notable_differences": "Business automation ads focus on SEO; workflow automation ads focus on tools or software."
}]

options.systemMessage:
=You are a senior marketing analyst tasked with generating clear, insightful email reports from structured JSON ad intelligence data. The input will include 3 major sections: 1. value proposition & messaging analysis 2. site link insights 3. keyword-to-ad mapping Your job is to write an **HTML-formatted email body** (not plain text), focusing on clarity, structure, and highlighting useful patterns, trends, and strategic insights. **Requirements:** - No greetings or closings; just the body. - Use `

`, `
    `, `

    `, ``, and styled `

    `s for clarity. - Group insights advertiser-by-advertiser. - Highlight value propositions, tones, messaging devices, and common phrases. - Break down site link strategies per advertiser. - Analyze keyword mapping per keyword, with competitive comparisons. - Summarize notable differences and strategic positioning. - Close with a quick recap of key marketing trends observed. The tone should be professional and analytical. Keep sections distinct and easy to scan. Use bullet points where appropriate. Ensure it can be pasted into a marketing performance report email. The report is intended for an admin or strategist. Generate only the HTML block ‚Äî no Markdown or narrative explanation.

parameters.subject: =Ads overview report for the Keyword [{{ $('set keyword').item.json.search_term }}]

parameters.content:

These ai steps analyze and extract different results from the top and bottom ads found on the given page per keyword
